Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, twelve dilute lines between black bands; wall glazed; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on interior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. Inscriptions on the interior surface of South Ionian cups are rare, they are usually found on the exterior surface of the rim or handle zone.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 277)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.711) (Phase 3)
